definition: to practice/to train/to drill/to perfect (one's skill)/exercise/(literary) white silk/to boil and scour raw silk
"silk" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 120), occurring in 红, 绿, 累 etc/also pr. [mi4]
to train hard/to practice diligently/hard work/blood, sweat, and tears

sentences.english: The students and the instructor go out driving for blocks of two hours.
sentences.chinese: 指导员与学生出去练两个小时。

sentences.english: My cousin Roran and I, we've trained, with swords!
sentences.chinese: 我表哥罗伦和我都练过剑。

sentences.english: I know, you must now be in very hard very hard practice songs.
sentences.chinese: 我知道，你现在一定在很努力很努力的练歌吧。

sentences.english: Let the woman keep, not equal to practiced a sunflower treasure Dian to calculate from the temple.
sentences.chinese: 让女人养吧，不如自宫练葵花宝典算了。

sentences.english: Practice English even when you fall down. ;
sentences.chinese: 甚至在跌倒时也练英语。

sentences.english: Despite his obvious desire to focus on singing, Lin is set to also work on dancing.
sentences.chinese: 虽然他很想专注于唱歌方面，他也很努力的练跳舞。

sentences.english: Just did my homework and practiced the piano.
sentences.chinese: 只是写家庭作业，练钢琴。

sentences.english: I overdid it in the gym and hurt my back.
sentences.chinese: 我在健身房练得过火了，结果弄伤了背。

sentences.english: And some three star hotel is actively practice the internal organs, to meet competition.
sentences.chinese: 而一些三星级酒店则积极练好内功，迎接竞争。

sentences.english: I also learned a few tricks.
This is daily Pilates classes and one meal a month .
sentences.chinese: 这就是练普拉提和每月只吃1顿饭的结果。

sentences.english: She penned these while practising her writing.
sentences.chinese: 这是她练写信的时候写的。

sentences.english: But I like it. Few people turn out to be more quiet and more freedom.
sentences.chinese: 我挺喜欢这样的，人少，练得更加宁静自在。

sentences.english: He was practicing the piano while other children of his age were playing games.
sentences.chinese: 当他在练钢琴时，同龄的其他孩子正在玩耍。

definition: to toughen/to temper/to engage in physical exercise/to work out/(fig.) to develop one's skills/to train oneself
to train hard/to practice diligently/hard work/blood, sweat, and tears
to warm up (sports)/(fig.) to prepare/to get in condition
